newsitem.title: FRANCE: Automobiles Peugeot to shed 2,816 jobs. [CORRECTED 15:22 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Automobiles Peugeot to shed 2,816 jobs. [CORRECTED 15:22 GMT]

text.p: Automobiles Peugeot, a car division of PSA Peugeot Citroen, said on Monday it would shed 2,816 jobs at its Poissy plant on the western outskirts of Paris and other plants. (Corrects to make clear that not all lay offs at Poissy)
The job cuts would be carried out through volutary redundancies, using such measures as early retirement and other incentive plans, a spokesman said.
"There will be no (compulsory) layoffs, it will all be voluntary," the spokesman said. Automobiles Peugeot employs a total of 50,000 workers, he said.
The company said in a statement that the job reduction plan would be presented to the company's staff council on June 11.
It said the move was aimed at increasing competitiveness in face of an intensifying price war in France, Spain and Italy as in the rest of Europe.
Other plants affected by the job cuts include Sochaux, Mulhouse, Sept-Fons, Valenciennes, Cergy and Melun, the company said in a statement.
